briefdescription.para: Flag to log all errors to the Unity console automatically
Event that occurs when the peer is ready

detaileddescription.para: This is the same as Webrtc.OnInitialized but is included here for convienience

briefdescription.para: Event that occurs when data is ready from the data channel
Event that occurs when a peer-specific failure happens
Event that occurs when an ice candidate is prepared
Event that occurs when the data channel is ready
Event that occurs when an sdp message is prepared
Event that occurs when an sdp offer is prepared
Event that occurs when an sdp answer is prepared
The underlying peer
Internal queue used to marshal work back to the main unity thread
Initialization handler

This is expected to be bound to Webrtc.OnInitialized via the UnityEditor

briefdescription.para: we front the IPeer interface for the underlying peer so that UnityEvents and engine code have something they can bind to to trigger the actual calls
Add an ice candidate
Add a stream

parameterdescription.para: flag indicating if the stream should only contain audio

briefdescription.para: Close the peer connection
Create an sdp answer
Create an sdp offer
Get the unique id
Send data via the created data channel
Adjust audio controls
Set the remote stream description
We provide a function Log() that matches the params of all exposed events so that one may easily wire UnityEvents to Log calls using this.Log() as a reference in editor
Unity Engine Update() hook
Unity Engine OnDestroy() hook
Internal handler for on-failure, if AutoLogErrors is true
Internal handler for processing local sdp's into separate events for offers and answers
We front the comms peer events (note: not video/audio events) so that UnityEvents and engine code have something they can bind to
Peer event frontend
